text:

However, from what I can make out, it's actually a giant, shitty-assed space Apurikoto.

name: soticoto
text:
Alt Text: Philippe ponders the similarity between this new "bidet" device and the Japanese squat toilet mentioned to him by his old friend Ultra Peanut, and decides to go find out for himself.
Bad things happen.

name: baryonyx
text: ALT TEXT: Scientific imperialism is a term that appears to have been coined by Dr Ellis T Powell when addressing the Commonwealth Club of Canada on 8 September 1920. Though he defined imperialism as "the sense of arbitrary and capricious domination over the bodies and souls of men," yet he used the term "scientific imperialism" to mean "the subjection of all the developed and undeveloped powers of the earth to the mind of man."

name: carlyle
text: Alt text: Tomorrow's recipe: Chicken!

name: persnicket
text: i have nightmares where i know i'm drinking bidet water but i'm powerless to stop

name: carterst
text: Philippe is quick to associate butts and water with meanness.

name: lateadopter
text: Wait, what about Walk-Around...BUTT!!  That was so nice it crapped pistachios.  I think it was the part about shooting water up the butt that gave the little nipper pause.

name: afkpuz
text: If only Philippe had thought to test the bidet with walk-around butt...

name: atticusonline
text: The Walk-Around Butt did not crap out pistachios. You had to dig for them.

name: persnicket

text: Ask Senator Larry Craig.

name: spinynorman
text: There's salad bidets and dessert bidets and Friday bidets, and bidets for when you're just done watching a whole DVD of a TV show... The ass is a mercurial segment of the body. Its needs must be attended to.

name: ssddr
text: Everytime Phillipe appears these days, it seems like his face gets smaller and smaller relative to the size of his head, it really bothers me. And his nose is HUUUUUGE

name: persnicket
text: or i dream i'm eating a gigantic marshmallow and when i wake up it turns out i've been drinking bidet water

name: milesdonovan
text: Seeing Lyle in his new glasses is going to take some getting used to.  I feel like he's about to start trying to teach biology, except because it's Lyle it would just deteriorate into a shouting lecture about the role amino acids play in beating the shit out of a dude who shit talks pre-"Load" Metallica.

text: I like his glasses quite a lot!

text: A comment left by zefiel was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by entropyends, ppccd, le_chien_manquee)

name: seanbad
text: Old School . Chubby for the reminder of my sold-at-a-yard-sale childhood.

name: j-man
text: I'm currently living in Japan, so bidets and the like are pretty commonplace around these parts. I've never seen them as drinking fountains for dogs, though. What a neat decision!

name: stormagnet
text:
The ones with ass warmers ROCK.

That said though, Washlets are scary.
One of the first things I saw on TV when arriving in Japan was a news flash about a Washlet that had blown up when plugged into a poorly grounded outlet. This totally stuck in my head throughout the Pat Gets His Dick Electrocuted arc.

name: psykeres
text: A comment left by psykeres was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by unaware, thedudeabides85, Mastronaut)

name: maggie
text: I was wary at first, too. But curiosity eventually got the better of me (it always does).

name: phthoggos
text: I approve of this strip. And the fact that Lyle's glasses seem to be permanent.

name: obvious
text:
Facing oneself in the bottom of a toilet. Reminds me of the "notorious Eisenkröte" from Gravity's Rainbow:

"For it is indeed an Iron Toad, faithfully rendered, thousand-warted and some say faintly smiling, a foot long at its longest, lurking at the bottom of a rank shit-stained toilet and hooked up to the European Grid through a rheostat control rigged to deliver varying though not lethal surges of voltage and current. No one knows who sits behind the rheostat . . . But you just never know. Often enough to matter, the current will be there - piranha-raid and salmon-climb up the gold glittering fall of piss, your treacherous ladder of salts and acids, bringing you back into touch with Mother Ground . . ."

text: I love the way Philippe and Lyle interact, always have. Such a great contrast.

text: judging from how Lyle quivers in panel 3, I'm positing that Lyle found this out the hard way...

name: raia
text: Actually, I figured he was delivering this line in the ubiquitous movie-preview-announcer's voice.  I can speak in that voice, but only if my neck muscles are clenched really tight.

name: rogergs
text: Anything a bidet can shoot at Lyle, Lyle can shoot back ... with interest .

name: tekende
text: You just gave me a delightful mental image of Lyle on a bidet, water blasting up his ass as he simultaneously emits streams of vomit from his mouth.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
Vomit? How quaint. I was thinking explosive diarrhea lazed in a stream no more than 1 cm in diameter via remarkable sphincter muscle control...which I assume Lyle no doubt has.

(Sorry to give retardo such primo j/o material.)

name: cdl146
text: I'm still getting used to the glasses. And what happened to the hat? His head looks huge without it. You could land a plane on that forehead.

text: Long story

name: andrew_
text:
It shoots water up your butt. is almost as good a statement as it will electrocute his dick.

I know it's been said but, it seems that anytime Philippe talks to Lyle, someone gets pretty upset.

name: shoinan
text:
Superb strip!

Now what does Philippe's final commment mean? Is he scared that if he's too mean he might die? Or that because he's too mean the bidet will be mean back enough for him to pass away? Or does he think all mean people lose their possessions?

It's a conundrum.

text: Philippe's nose looks more expressive than usual.  bidet usage anticipation can do that to you.

text: his nose isnt more expressive, its just that his eyes are tiny scared

Pssst! Philippe! That bidet would make an excellent racing oval for Mr. Bear's Stompers!
http://m.assetbar.com/achewood/uua6S5Gzk

name: lawdog
text: Phillipe is no stranger to curious goings on in the restroom...

name: woodenteeth
text: Bidet's in Australia are virtually non-existant. It seems entirely alien and disturbing but at it's essence unarguably practical. Freud has a lot to answer for...

name: twohundredninety
text: They're really rare in America, too. I mean, I have occasionally seen them for sale in places where they sell plumbing and appliances and stuff, but I've never actually seen one installed in a house.

name: plezure
text: My action figure fell in the bidet.

name: riazm
text: Lyle is the anti Lie-Bot

name: cdtm
text: ALT TEXT: There is something, so in order to be polite, Philippe must use it.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: I am sure Lyle will make good use of those action rangers.

name: jackparsons
text: An American couple goes to Europe. The hotel clerk shows them the bathroom. "Oh, how cute! Is that to wash the baby in?" "No madam, that is to wash the baby out ."

name: flazisismuss
text: It's moments like this that I really, really admire Phillippe.  I wish I was more like a 5-year old otter.

name: untilyouaresonude
text: If Hitler used a bidet? Psssshhh...forget about it.

name: blarghamagarky
text: Does Lyle look a little bit fatter on this day?

name: drago25
text: Having dealt with those things in Italy a couple years ago, I very much understand Phillipe's trepidation.

name: tekende
text: So, I've always wondered...do they shoot up, like, hard, or is it sort of a gentle fountain?

name: drago25
text: I don't recall being brave enough to try, good sir. I had about the expression Philippe has in the strip. But I can only imagine.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
To answer tekende's question: I lived in London for three years as a teenager, and our family apartment had one in one of the bathrooms. On mine you could adjust the strength of the water, just like a bath tub, and move the nozzle to adjust the arc. It wasn't like powerwashing a house or anything...I guess it can't be too strong or else the water would end up all over the bathroom.

After about 2 years, I worked up the courage to give a whirl...but it just ain't right. I just kind of squatted there and let the water flow twixt my cheeks like a lazy creek in summer. That didn't work. So I said "fuck this," and grabbed some tp, but then I just got wet toilet paper all over my ass. I didn't know it at the time, but I guess you gotta get crackin', so to speak, with your hand or something.

Plus the water is normally cold; not really a pleasant experience.

This is the second in depth discussion I've had on AssetBar about post-fecal sanitation.

I am currently reviewing my priorities in life.

name: tekende
text: Excellent, thanks for the information and for making me laugh.

name: fineoakstructure
text:
De nada.

Wait, what the fuck? Someone is posting today on a strip that isn't The Kazenzakis Card Company ?

Unthinkable.

name: thaes
text: A pity. My verbal capabilities are not enough to describe the hilariousness of this strip in a short, professional manner. Thus, this post telling that I can't do it must suffice.

name: scleropages
text: I love how Lyle shakes when he says "It shoots water up your butt." He knows he just shattered Philippe's reality.
